title.narrative: ADB Core Environment Programme (CEP) Phase II, 2012-2017
ADB Core Environment Programme (CEP) Phase II, 2012-2017

description.narrative: Core Env Program (CEP) omfattar fyra områden: (i) miljöplaneringssystem, metoder och förbättrade skyddsåtgärder, (ii) hantering av gränsöverskridande områden för biologisk mångfald och förbättring av lokala försörjningsmöjligheter, (iii) klimatresilienta investeringar och strategier för minskade koldioxidutsläpp samt (iv) stärkande av institutioner och miljöförvalning.

The Core Env Program (CEP) comprises four outputs: (i) environmental planning systems, methods and safeguards improved; (ii) management of trans-boundary biodiversity conservation landscapes and local livelihoods improved; (iii) climate resilient investments and low carbon strategies developed; and (iv) institutions and financing for sustainable environmental management strengthened.

The programme's main outcome objective is an "Environment-friendly and climate-resilient GMS Economic Cooperation Program". The CEP goals were to (i) create an environmentally friendly and ecologically rich GMS to enhance the environmental sustainability of the GMS Economic Cooperation Program and (ii) improve biodiversity conservation and climate resilience across the GMS.

tag.narrative: 13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.
13.2 - Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning.
13.2 - Integrera klimatåtgärder i politik, strategier och planering på nationell nivå.

13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.

15.2 - By 2020, promote the implementation of sustainable management of all types of forests, halt deforestation, restore degraded forests and substantially increase afforestation and reforestation globally.

15.2 - Till 2020 främja genomförandet av hållbart brukande av alla typer av skogar, stoppa avskogningen, återställa utarmade skogar och kraftigt öka nybeskogningen och återbeskogningen i hela världen.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Asian Development Bank together with its partners - the Governments of Finland and Sweden, and the Nordic Development Fund (NDF) and Global Environment Facility (GEF) co-financed the Core Environment Programme (CEP). Sida contributed with 55 MSEK to the ADB to support the second phase of CEP for the period of 2012 to 2019. ADB approved the CEP Phase II in 2011 (TA 7987). Implementation of CEP Phase II began in mid-2012. The CEP Phase II focuses four themes: (i) strategic planning, safeguards and monitoring; (ii) transboundary biodiversity landscapes and local livelihoods; (iii) climate change; and (iv) institutions and financing. The results that have been achieved include: - All planned activities under the current Technical Assistance were successfully completed by 31 December 2018. - The programme has contributed significantly to the development of infrastructure to enable the development and sharing of the resource base, and promote the free flow of goods, services and people in the subregion. It has also led to the international recognition of the GMS as a dynamic growth area in Southeast Asia. - The CEP Strategic Framework and Action Plan 2018–2022 was endorsed by the GMS Environment Ministers at the fifth GMS Environment Ministers’ Meeting (EMM5) in February 2018 in Chiang Mai, Thailand. - CEP’s knowledge exchange platforms, such as transboundary biodiversity landscapes (TBL) forums and climate change roundtables, are well established and increasingly being recognized for their efforts to strengthen the regional knowledge base and to influence investments by the GMS governments and international organizations.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
